byline.contributor: Susanne Craig reported from Albany, and William K. Rashbaum from New York.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and state lawmakers seem to be near deal on ethics policies that would increase what state politicians must disclose about outside income; critics say proposal leaves open too many loopholes for lawyers.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo says the effort makes good on his vow to bring sunlight to Albany’s ethical shadows; critics say that the reforms don’t go far enough in forcing lawmakers who are lawyers to disclose outside income.

headline.main: Cuomo and Lawmakers Appear Near to Ethics Reform Deal
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and Lawmakers Seem to Be Near a Deal on New Ethics Rules

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo says the effort makes good on his vow to bring sunlight to Albany’s ethical shadows; critics say that the reforms don’t go far enough in forcing lawmakers who are lawyers to disclose outside income.
